On this page I have put together a short list of link to sites where you can find the advertisement for scholarship positions. Most information about scholarship offers are readily available on the Internet, you can either subscribe to Facebook groups or mailing lists that updates scholarships positions, or surf on search engine using specific keywords. See below a list of some scholarship websites classified into different categories.

General scholarship sites : All possible subjects
- Scholarships for development
- Scholarships positions
- After school Africa
- International scholarships
- UNESCO

Scholarships by Country : All possible subjects
- Eiffel Scholarship, France
- Erasmus Mundus, Europe
- Commonwealth, United Kingdom
- Fullbright Foreign student scholarships, USA
- DAAD, Germany
- Australian International Postgraduate Research Scholarship
- NewZealand Postgraduate scholarships
- Canadian Vanier Graduate Scholarships
- Finland Government Scholarships
- Belgium, VLIR-UOS Masters & Training Scholarships
- Swiss Government Scholarship

Fluid dynamics, Geosciences, Applied Mathematics, Physics and Oceanography
- ICTP Scholarship Programmes, Italy
- ICTP Postgraduate Diploma Programme, Italy
- Computational Fluid Dynamics
- Metjobs
- Earthworks
- Max Planck Research School on Earth System Modelling, Germany
- Mathematics for Planet Earth, UK
- NERC Funding
- Ecole Doctoral TUE, Grenoble, France
- CNES Phd and Postdoc grants, France

Scholarships by Institutions
- Gates Cambridge Scholarships, UK : All possible courses
- Berlin Mathematical School, Germany : Applied Mathematics and Computing
- AIMS, Africa : Structured Masters in Mathematics
- Masdar Institute of Science and Technology Science and Engineering
- KAUST, Saudi Arabia : Science and Engineering
- KFUMP, Saudi Arabia : Science and Engineering
- University of Readings, UK : All possible subjects
- Inria, France : Applied Mathematics and Computing

Facebook Page/Group
- Postgraduate Scholarships
- Phd and Postdocs

Scholarship offers are numerous and many do not find their way to the pages of the websites listed above. To get information about these funding opportunity, you need to search the university, laboratory websites or rather punch in some specific key words on search engine. Graduate/Research assistants positions may be advertised or not, depending on the university. For some universities, you need to contact a potential supervisor then discuss if he/she has research grant to acquire you as a GA for a masters degree or a Phd. Also, graduate funding in the US comes mostly as GA positions, so you need to check the website of the Department/University you intend to apply to.

For additional information, you can check my post on postgraduate scholarship tips for more detailed materials on application processes, links to materials on how to write good SOP and how to initiate communication with a potential supervisor.
